meanings.definition: The property of certain substances to change color when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: The photochromisms of the fabric made it perfect for outdoor activities.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study photochromisms to understand how colors can transform under sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The photochromisms of the chameleon suit made it blend seamlessly with any background.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was like photochromisms, shifting from bright to dark with each passing moment.
meanings.sent5: The photochromisms of the flowers in the garden created a mesmerizing display of hues.

meanings.definition: The process of reversible color changes in a material due to light exposure.
meanings.sent1: The photochromisms of the paint allowed the artist to create interactive artwork.
meanings.sent2: Photochromisms in sunglasses help protect the eyes by adjusting to the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The photochromisms of the mood ring entertained the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: His personality was like photochromisms, adapting to different situations effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The photochromisms of the sky at sunset painted a breathtaking scene over the horizon.
